intro: Securidaca hebeclada, commonly known as the African senna, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and traditional uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
